project.teaser: It is the key objective of the project CRISTAL (40 months) to increase the share of freight transport on inland water transport (IWT) by a minimum of 20% and to demonstrate on its three pilot sites (Italy, Poland and France) strategies to improve reliability by 80%. CRISTAL...
project.objective: It is the key objective of the project CRISTAL (40 months) to increase the share of freight transport on inland water transport (IWT) by a minimum of 20% and to demonstrate on its three pilot sites (Italy, Poland and France) strategies to improve reliability by 80%. CRISTAL project will assure IWT capacity at 50% even during extreme weather events. Towards that CRISTAL will co-create, test and implement integrated, cooperative and innovative solutions in its three pilot partners’ areas identified in Italy, France and Poland. The project will include the aspects of technological innovation/development and digitalization; further advancement towards the Physical Internet, governance solution and business models, will be proposed while targeting sustainability and infrastructure resilience requirements.
project.title: Climate resilient and environmentally sustainable transport infrastructure, with a focus on inland waterways
project.keywords: intelligant transport system, sustainable transport, digitalisation, synchromodality, modal shift, resilience

result.title: D7.1 RP Specification and Baseline measurements.
result.description: D7.1 will provide RP Specification and Baseline measurements including action plan to equip IWW with cold-ironing facilities.

result.title: D11.2 Updated version of the Project Dissemination and Communication Plan
result.description: Updated version of the Project Dissemination and Communication Plan.

result.title: D5.1 Technical concept of a digital twin
result.description: Based on the requirements identified the conceptual design of CRISTAL digital twin architecture will be built. Interfaces and data flow mechanisms between the components including sensors, platforms, external information systems and CRISTAL software components will also be specified in this deliverable.

result.title: D6.1 Analysis of AS-IS situation of River Pilots.
result.description: D6.1 provides innovation implementation & assessment plans including infrastructure corridor analysis and simulation-based analysis of predicted flows.

result.title: D2.1 Interface specification and system architecture preliminary requirements
result.description: D2.1 represents the Software Requirements Specifications (SRS) of the CRISTAL technology platform. CRISTAL technology platform acquires data from sensors technologies developed in CRISTAL, stores and processes them to provide useful, easily accessible, and usable information to the pilots, in terms of KPIs, via dedicated Apps and Dashboards. D2.1 specifies the intended use, the intended audience (i.e. stakeholders, asset managers, etc.) and the user needs of CRISTAL technology platform for each of the pilots. D2.1 specifies the following requirements for CRISTAL technology platform: functional requirements, external interface requirements, interoperability with existing and already in use platforms at the pilots, system features, non-functional requirements (e.g. performance, safety, security, quality).

result.title: D8.1 French RP Specification and Baseline measurements
result.description: Report on French River Pilot assumptions including: 1. Aim of the pilot; 2. Assumptions for pilot execution; 3. Research methodology and measurement of outputs; 4. Expected results structure;

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - CRISTAL (Climate resilient and environmentally sustainable transport infrastructure, with a focus on inland waterways)
result.teaser: Despite its vast potential, the inland waterways market share in Europe remains relatively low, standing at only 5.8% in 2020. Recognizing the need for innovation and infrastructure development, CRISTAL is leading the charge toward a more sustainable and efficient...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: D1.1 Domain Map, Vision Statement and Requirements
result.description: The resulting roadmap will outline and prioritize the processes that need changing in order to achieve the vision of a (almost) fully available inland waterway infrastructure including ready to use and low resistance fallback solutions.

result.title: D3.1 Specifications on synchromodal transport management systems, components and services [R, PU]
result.description: Defining the main requirements and specifications of the synchro-modal transport management system, its components and services: Use cases and architecture definition and guidelines on international standards.

result.title: D4.1 Detailed requirements for the assessment method
result.description: In this report the detailed feasibility requirements for the Living Labs (LL) governance framework are collected, by understanding the logistic ecosystems, creating a plan to develop the Living Lab, and elaborating on the agreement between all actors across the three cases.

result.title: D1.3 Roadmaps as Blueprints for Wider Applicability and Use
result.description: This deliverable will define the main aspects of the strategic vision, as requirements, solutions, current and future operations and economic risks of stakeholders.

result.title: D4.2 Development of a living labs governance framework
result.description: In this report the generic governance framework is developed. This governance framework has as goal to mitigate disruptions on the IWT network. This entails both the operations of the vessels (corridor management) as well as the (predictive) maintenance of the IWT infrastructure (WP2 technologies).

result.title: D9.1 Polish RP Specification and Baseline measurements
result.description: Report on Polish River Pilot assumptions including: 1. Aim of the pilot; 2. Assumptions for pilot execution; 3. Research methodology and measurement of outputs; 4. Expected results structure;

result.title: D3.2 Guidelines for the sustainability and resilience of IWT&L
result.description: "The guidelines will be based on the ISO 22301 Business continuity management systems, ISO 37123, Sustainable cities and communities – Indicators for resilient cities, ISO/TS 22375:2018 Security and resilience — Guidelines for complexity assessment process, ISO 1406x series for assessing and verifying GHG emissions, ISO 14090 Managing the impact of climate change, ISO 22320:2018 Emergency management — Guidelines for incident management, ISO 55001 Asset management , ISO 14001 Environmental quality management, ISO 50001 Energy Management System, ISO 26000 social accountability, ""Taxonomy"" Regulation EU 852/2020, Dir.CE 95/2014 Corporate sustainability reporting on the social and environmental impacts of their activities, EC TAXONOMY."

result.title: D4.3 Development of the business models
result.description: This report will describe the business models and how they quantify the main cost and benefits of the potential implementation of the developed technologies in WP2 and the corridor management system (WP3). It will describe the business models developed for the technologies in WP2 and for the corridor management plan (WP3). The report will be presented to a Joint Workshop with Advisory Board, pilot partners and Stakeholders to validate the developed business models.

result.title: D11.1 Development of the Project Dissemination and Communication Plan
result.description: Reports the dissemination and communication plan developed that defines the strategy and specific steps to identify the target audiences and communication actions. The plan will describe a wide range of diverse activities to inform as wide an audience as possible against the Key Performance Indicators to assess and monitor the success of the actions.

result.title: D1.2 Stakeholders Evaluation and Key Innovative Technology Assessment
result.description: This deliverable will define the main aspects of the strategic vision, as requirements, solutions, current and future operations and economic risks of stakeholders Also key technology needs will be evaluated, considering the solutions for better year-round use of inland navigation resources, infrastructure management, infrastructure monitoring technologies and corridor management systems.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
